p: Reflecting on the social meanings and practices in ecovillages, connected to the sustainability dimensions, it is possible to recognize that they align with systemic alternative principles in many ways, regarding the economic, ecological, social, cultural, and ethical-political aspects. This is because the pluriverse of community-led alternatives engages in an important variety of projects and actions connected to the commitments of ecological integrity, social equity and justice, meaningful participation, collective responsibility, cultural diversity recognition, and solidarity values (Escobar 2018; Roysen et al. 2021; Kothari 2021; Solón et al. 2019).
